election_record.label: New York 1807 State Senate, Eastern District

overview.note: The official canvass of votes as listed in the American Citizen (New York, NY), June 12, and the Columbian Gazette, June 16, lists 9102 votes for Isaac Kellogg, 8932 votes for John MacLean, 7256 votes for Abraham Ten Eyck, 7236 votes for Edward Savage, 7187 votes for Asa Mann, and 7093 votes for Stephen Cuyler in the Eastern District. The county totals listed, however, add up to the totals listed here.
Edward Savage received 68 votes as Edws Savage.

The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 9, lists 9109 votes for Isaac Kellogg, 8981 votes for Charles Selden, 7259 votes for Abraham Ten Eyck, 7240 votes for Edward Savage, 7233 votes for Asa Mann, and 7095 votes for Stephen Cuyler in the Eastern District.

sub_unit.name: Albany
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 9, lists 1324 votes for Isaac Kellogg and 1679 votes for Stephen Cuyler in Albany county.

sub_unit.name: One
sub_unit.note: Charles Shelden received 1 vote as Charles Selden.

sub_unit.name: Two
sub_unit.note: Charles Shelden received 1 vote as Charles Selden.

sub_unit.name: Four
sub_unit.note: Charles Shelden received 2 votes as Charles Selden.

sub_unit.name: Three
sub_unit.note: Charles Shelden received 35 votes as Charles Selden.

sub_unit.name: Clinton
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 9, lists 222 votes for Asa Mann in Clinton county.
The American Citizen (New York, NY), June 12, and the Columbian Gazette, June 16, list 421 votes for Charles Selden and 222 votes for Abraham Ten Eyck in Clinton county.

sub_unit.name: Essex
sub_unit.note: Abraham Ten Eyck received 3 votes as Abraham Ven Eyck.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 9, lists 253 votes for Abraham Ten Eyck in Essex county.

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), June 12, and the Columbian Gazette, June 16, lists 1589 votes for Isaac Kellogg in Montgomery county.
Charles Selden received 24 votes as Charles Sheldon.
John MacLean received 1 vote as John MacLeal.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 9, lists 1590 votes for Isaac Kellogg and 1591 votes for Charles Selden in Montgomery county.

sub_unit.name: Rensselaer
sub_unit.note: Stephen Cuyler received 1 vote as Steven Cuyler.
Isaac Kellogg received 1 vote as Isaac Kelling.
Charles Selden received 1 vote as Charles Selin.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 9, lists 1498 votes for Isaac Kellogg and 1508 votes for Charles Selden in Rensselaer county.

sub_unit.name: Grafton
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists 81 votes for Isaac Kellogg.

sub_unit.name: Hoosick
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists 106 votes for Abraham Ten Eyck.

sub_unit.name: Philipstown
sub_unit.note: The Northern Budget, May 5, and The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 7, list 65 votes each for Isaac Kellogg, Charles Selden, John Tayler, and John MacLean in Philipstown.

sub_unit.name: Pittstown
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists 100 votes for Asa Mann.

sub_unit.name: Schodack
sub_unit.note: The Northern Budget, May 5 and 12, and The Public Advertiser (New York, NY), May 8, list no votes from Schodack.

sub_unit.name: Stephentown
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists 46 votes for Charles Selden.

sub_unit.name: Troy
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists 175 votes for Edmund Savage.

sub_unit.name: Saratoga
sub_unit.note: Charles Selden received 2 votes as Charles Sheldon.
John Taylor received 1 vote as John Taylor.
Stephen Cuyler received 1 vote as Stephen Chuyler.
The American Citizen (New York, NY), June 12, and the Columbian Gazette, June 16, list 1724 votes for Charles Selden, 1726 votes for John MacLean, and 918 votes for Asa Mann in Saratoga county.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 9, lists 1734 votes for Isaac Kellogg, 941 votes for Asa Mann, 927 votes for Stephen Cuyler, and 934 votes for Edward Savage in Saratoga county.
The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 26, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 26, list 1722 votes for Charles Selden and 1726 votes for John MacLean.

sub_unit.name: Hadley
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 26, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 26, list 88 votes for Isaac Kellogg and 86 votes for Charles Selden in Hadley.

sub_unit.name: Malta
sub_unit.note: Isaac Kellogg received 1 vote as Isaac Kell.

sub_unit.name: Northfield
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 26, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 26, list 101 votes for Isaac Kellogg and 103 votes for Charles Selden in Northfield.

sub_unit.name: Northumberland
sub_unit.note: Stephen Cuyler received 1 vote as Stephen Schuyler.

sub_unit.name: Providence
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 26, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 26, list 52 votes for Stephen Cuyler in Providence.

sub_unit.name: Saratoga
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 18, the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 26, and the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 26, list 151 votes for John MacLean and 152 votes for Charles Selden in the town of Saratoga.

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: Isaac Kellog received 1 vote as Isaac Kellogg.
Edward Savage received 2 votes as Edward Sage.

The official canvass of votes lists in the American Citizen (New York, NY), June 12, and the Columbian Gazette, June 16, list 1169 votes for Abraham Ten Eyck, 1168 votes for Asa Mann, and 1168 votes for Stephen Cuyler in Washington county.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 9, lists 1982 votes for Isaac Kellogg, 1170 votes for Abraham Ten Eyck, and 1143 votes for Edward Savage in Washington county.

election_record.reference: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY). May 8, 1807.
